info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 5 at 3:59PM PDT until May 5 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS Las Vegas NV
info.description:
* WHAT...Minor flooding caused by widespread rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southern Nevada, including the following county, Clark.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 359 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated widespread moderate rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 0.25 inches of rain have fallen and pockets of up to 0.50 are possible in the coming hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Las Vegas, Henderson, North Las Vegas, Boulder City, Rainbow Canyon, Mountains Edge, Blue Diamond, Spring Valley, Enterprise, Southern Highlands, Summerlin, The Strip, Red Rock Canyon, Paradise, Lone Mountain, Fremont Street, Anthem, Green Valley, Jean and Centennial Hills. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PDT THIS EVENING
